concept-wr.title: CPU Profiles
concept-wr.shortdesc: A CPU profile is a named assignment of processors and cores to specific types of processing functions.

conbody.draft-comment: US66653 new topic created to hold existing content, formerly held as section
conbody.p: Each CPU profile assigns cores to one or more of the following types of functions:

dd.p: System functions handling maintenance, inventory, and VM hosting for the host. Platform functions are always present on all types of hosts in the cluster.
AVS functions dedicated to handling various networking tasks for VMs (L2 switching, L3 routing, QoS, SNAT, floating IP addresses, and so on). They exist on the compute nodes only.
Functions handling low-load or non-real-time virtual machine tasks, implemented on a shared physical CPU in a compute node.
Functions handling virtual machines. They exist on the compute nodes only.

conbody.p: On controller and storage nodes, all cores are automatically assigned to platform functions, as they are the only ones available. On compute nodes, which always run a number of functions of all types, a default CPU allocation is done automatically when the system software is initially installed.
CPU profiles are shown on the CPU Profiles tab on the Host Inventory page.
